title: Installation & CLI
content:
Installing Angular CLI

The Angular CLI (Command Line Interface) is a powerful tool that helps you create, develop, test, and deploy Angular applications. It's your primary companion throughout Angular development.

What is Angular CLI?

Angular CLI is a command-line tool that provides:

  • Project scaffolding: Creates new Angular projects with best practices
  • Code generation: Generates components, services, modules, and more
  • Development server: Serves your application with hot reload
  • Build tools: Compiles and optimizes your application for production
  • Testing utilities: Runs unit and end-to-end tests
  • Linting and formatting: Maintains code quality standards

Global Installation

Install Angular CLI globally so you can use it from anywhere on your system:

CLI Version Management

Different projects might use different Angular versions. The CLI handles this automatically, but you can also:

  • Check your global CLI version
  • Update to the latest version
  • Use specific versions for different projects

Essential CLI Commands

Once installed, you'll use these commands frequently:

  • ng new - Create a new Angular project
  • ng serve - Start the development server
  • ng generate - Generate code (components, services, etc.)
  • ng build - Build the application for production
  • ng test - Run unit tests
  • ng lint - Run linting checks

CLI Configuration

The CLI can be configured through:

  • angular.json: Project-specific configuration
  • Global config: Settings that apply to all projects
  • Workspace config: Settings for a specific workspace

Troubleshooting Common Issues

  • Permission errors: Use sudo on macOS/Linux or run as administrator on Windows
  • Network issues: Configure npm registry or use corporate proxy settings
  • Version conflicts: Clear npm cache and reinstall

codeExamples.title: Install Angular CLI Globally
codeExamples.description: Install the Angular CLI globally on your system to access it from any directory.
codeExamples.code:
# Install Angular CLI globally
npm install -g @angular/cli

# Verify installation
ng version

# Check available commands
ng help
codeExamples.explanation: The -g flag installs Angular CLI globally, making the 'ng' command available system-wide. This is a one-time setup step.
codeExamples.expectedOutput: Angular CLI installed globally with version information displayed

codeExamples.title: Check CLI and Angular Versions
codeExamples.description: Verify your Angular CLI installation and see detailed version information.
codeExamples.code:
# Detailed version information
ng version

# Output shows:
# Angular CLI: 17.x.x
# Node: 18.x.x
# Package Manager: npm 9.x.x
# OS: (your operating system)
# Angular: (if in an Angular project)

# Short version check
ng --version
codeExamples.explanation: The ng version command provides comprehensive information about your development environment, including CLI version, Node.js version, and more.
codeExamples.expectedOutput: Detailed version information for Angular CLI and development environment

codeExamples.title: Explore CLI Commands
codeExamples.description: Get familiar with the most important Angular CLI commands you'll use regularly.
codeExamples.code:
# Get help for all commands
ng help

# Get help for a specific command
ng generate --help
ng new --help
ng serve --help

# List available generators
ng generate --help

# Common command shortcuts
ng g c my-component    # Generate component (shorthand)
ng s                   # Serve (shorthand)
ng b                   # Build (shorthand)
codeExamples.explanation: The Angular CLI has many commands and options. Use --help to discover available options and learn command shortcuts for faster development.
codeExamples.expectedOutput: Comprehensive help information for Angular CLI commands and options

codeExamples.title: CLI Configuration Basics
codeExamples.description: Learn how to configure Angular CLI for your development preferences.
codeExamples.code:
# View current global configuration
ng config --global

# Set global default settings
ng config --global cli.packageManager npm
ng config --global schematics.@schematics/angular:component.style scss
ng config --global schematics.@schematics/angular:component.inlineTemplate false

# View specific configuration
ng config cli.packageManager

# Reset configuration
ng config --global cli.packageManager --remove
codeExamples.explanation: CLI configuration allows you to set defaults for new projects, such as preferred package manager, default styling format, and component generation options.
codeExamples.expectedOutput: Angular CLI configured with your preferred default settings

codeExamples.title: Update Angular CLI
codeExamples.description: Keep your Angular CLI up to date to access the latest features and bug fixes.
codeExamples.code:
# Update Angular CLI globally
npm install -g @angular/cli@latest

# Or update to a specific version
npm install -g @angular/cli@17.0.0

# Update CLI in an existing project
ng update @angular/cli

# Check what can be updated in your project
ng update
codeExamples.explanation: Regular updates ensure you have access to the latest Angular features, performance improvements, and bug fixes. Always check project compatibility before updating.
codeExamples.expectedOutput: Angular CLI updated to the latest version with confirmation message
